title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 184.2 - Penalties
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 184.2 - Penalties

State Regulations
(a) The violation
of any provisions of sections 182.1 through 182.22 and 183.1 through 183.3 of
this Subchapter shall constitute an offense punishable by a fine of not to
exceed $100. (b) The violation of
any provisions of sections 182.23 through
182.41
and
182.44
of this Subchapter shall
constitute a traffic infraction punishable by such fines and penalties as
provided in section 1800 of the New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law, and
acts amendatory thereof and supplemental thereto. (c) For the purpose of conferring
jurisdiction upon courts and judicial officers generally, violations of those
rules and regulations of the department which are herein defined as offenses
shall nevertheless be deemed misdemeanors for the sole purpose of making
applicable all procedural provisions of law relating to misdemeanors, and
courts of special sessions or city courts, as the case may be, shall in the
first instance have exclusive jurisdiction to hear and determine charges of
such offenses and no jury trial shall be allowed for such offenses. (Public

Authorities Law, ยง 460[4])

Notes

ยง
184.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
